message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the problem of learning a binary classifier from multiple data sources, some of which may be adversarial. This is a common problem in machine learning and falls under the category of "learning from multiple sources" or "ensemble learning". The paper also discusses the overhead of learning in this setting, which is a measure of the additional sample complexity required compared to learning from a single data source. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), cryptography (cs.CR), and social and information networks (cs.SI). However, given the focus on learning and classification, we believe that cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.DS, cs.CR, and cs.SI.
